name: Slack modules
title: Slack modules

children.text: After connecting to the Slack app, you can use the following modules to build your

You can watch public and private channel messages, watch direct and multiparty direct messages, watch scheduled messages, search for messages, list scheduled messages, retrieve private and public channel messages, list replies, create, update, schedule, and delete a message using the following modules.
Triggers when a new message is added to a public channel.

data.label: Slack
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Slack user account.

children.text: Select or map a public channel whose messages you want to watch.
Enter (map) a public channel name whose messages you want to watch.
Set the maximum number of public channel messages Make will return during one execution cycle. The default value is 2.

Select whether to enable pagination. When enabled, the module loads results with pagination. If you disable this option, the module only loads the first set of results, with a maximum of 15 items per page.
Disabling pagination can help if you encounter rate limit errors. If you need more than 15 results, keep pagination enabled.
Triggers when a new message is added to a private channel.

data.label: Slack
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Slack user account.

children.text: Select or map a private channel whose messages you want to watch.
Enter (map) a private channel name whose messages you want to watch.
Set the maximum number of private channel messages Make will return during one execution cycle. The default value is 2.

Select whether to enable pagination. When enabled, the module loads results with pagination. If you disable this option, the module only loads the first set of results, with a maximum of 15 items per page.
Disabling pagination can help if you encounter rate limit errors. If you need more than 15 results, keep pagination enabled.
Triggers when a new direct message is added to a direct message channel.

data.label: Slack
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Slack user account.

children.text: Select or map a direct message you want to watch.
Enter (map) a direct message channel name whose messages you want to watch. Alternatively, you can search for a direct message channel.
- Enter (map) a name to search for a multiparty direct message.
- Select whether to exclude the archived channels.
Set the maximum number of direct messages Make will return during one execution cycle. The default value is 2.

Select whether to enable pagination. When enabled, the module loads results with pagination. If you disable this option, the module only loads the first set of results, with a maximum of 15 items per page.
Disabling pagination can help if you encounter rate limit errors. If you need more than 15 results, keep pagination enabled.
Triggers when a new message is added to a multiparty direct message channel.

data.label: Slack
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Slack user account.

children.text: Select or map a multiple direct message channel whose messages you want to watch.
Enter (map) a multiple direct message name whose messages you want to watch. Alternatively, you can search for a direct message channel.
- Enter (map) a name to search for a direct message.
- Select whether to exclude the archived channels.
Set the maximum number of multiparty direct messages Make name will return during one execution cycle. The default value is 2.

Select whether to enable pagination. When enabled, the module loads results with pagination. If you disable this option, the module only loads the first set of results, with a maximum of 15 items per page.
Disabling pagination can help if you encounter rate limit errors. If you need more than 15 results, keep pagination enabled.
Returns messages matching a search query.

data.label: Slack
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Slack user account.

children.text: Enter the search term you want to search the workspace for. See
for a list of Search modifiers.
Set the maximum number of messages Make will return during one execution cycle. The default value is 2.
Returns a message with a given ID from a specified private channel.

data.label: Slack
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Slack user account.

children.text: Select or map a private channel whose messages you want to retrieve.
Enter (map) a private channel name whose messages you want to retrieve. Alternatively, you can search for a public channel.
- Enter (map) the channel name to search.
- Select whether to exclude the archived channels.
Enter (map) a Message ID of a message to retrieve.
Returns a message with a given ID from a specified public channel.

data.label: Slack
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Slack user account.

children.text: Select or map a public channel whose messages you want to retrieve.
Enter (map) a public channel name whose messages you want to retrieve. Alternatively, you can search for a public channel.
- Select whether to exclude the archived channels.
Enter (map) a Message ID of a message to retrieve.
Retrieves a thread messages posted to a conversation.
The parent message is always in the output, and it is always the first bundle. You can use a filter to skip the first item if you wish to process only the replies.

data.label: Slack
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Slack user account.

children.text: Select or map a public channel whose message you want to create.
Select or map a private channel whose message you want to create.
Select or map a user whose message you want to create.
Select or map a direct message to multiple people and list the replies.
Enter (map) a Parent message ID of a message whose replies you want to list.
Set the maximum number of replies Make will return during one execution cycle. The default value is 2.
Enter (map) a timestamp to list only replies sent after this time. This parameter doesn't prevent the parent message from being output.
Enter (map) a timestamp to list only replies sent before this time. This parameter does not prevent the parent message from being output.
Select whether to include replies that match the exact

Select whether to enable pagination. When enabled, the module loads results with pagination. If you disable this option, the module only loads the first set of results, with a maximum of 15 items per page.
Disabling pagination can help if you encounter rate limit errors. If you need more than 15 results, keep pagination enabled.
module requires your Slack bot to be a member of the selected channel. If the bot is not in the channel, the module will return

data.label: Slack
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Slack user account.

children.text: Enter a channel ID or name
Enter (map) a Channel ID or name whose message you want to create.
Note: You must specify a public channel, private channel, or a direct message channel. You can either pass the channel's name (#general) or encoded ID (C0123BE12L).
Select or map a public channel whose message you want to create.
Select or map a private channel whose message you want to create.
Select or map a direct message channel whose message you want to create.
Select or map a multiple direct message channel whose message you want to create.
Enter (map) the text content of the message you want to create.
For detailed information about text formatting, please refer to the
Enter (map) the blocks to be combined with messages to create visually rich and compellingly interactive messages.
For detailed information about text formatting, please refer to the
Enter (map) another message's time stamp value to make this message a reply. Avoid using a reply's time stamp value; use its parent instead.
Select whether they should be made visible to everyone in the channel or conversation.
Note: Used in conjunction with the Thread message ID.
Names and channels will not be linkified in the @username or #channel format unless you enable this option. For more information, refer to the
Select whether to parse the message text.
Note: Defines how messages are treated.
Disable Slack markup parsing by selecting the No option.
Enable this option to enable the unfurling of primarily text-based content. For detailed information about unfurling in Slack, refer to the
Disable this option to disable the unfurling of media content. For detailed information about unfurling in Slack, please refer to the
Enter (map) an emoji to use as the icon for this message. Overrides Icon URL.
This field only has an effect when using a Bot connection.
Enter (map) an Icon URL to an image to use as the icon for this message.
This field only has an effect when using a Bot connection.
Enter (map) a User name to Send a message.
If not specified, the default bot name will be used. This field only has an effect when using a Bot connection.

data.label: Slack
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Slack user account.

children.text: Enter a channel ID or name
Enter (map) an updated Channel ID or name whose message you want to create.
You must specify a public channel, private channel, or a direct message. You can either pass the channel's name (#general) or encoded ID (C0123BE12L).
Select or map a public channel whose message you want to create.
Select or map a private channel whose message you want to create.
Select or map a direct message whose message you want to create.
Select or map a multiple direct message whose message you want to create.
Enter (map) the message's time stamp value or the Message ID to whose text you want to edit.
Enter (map) the text content of the message you want to create.
For detailed information about text formatting, please refer to the
Enter (map) the blocks to be combined with messages to create visually rich and compellingly interactive messages.
For detailed information about text formatting, please refer to the
Names and channels will not be linkified in the @username or #channel format unless you enable this option. For more information, refer to the
Select whether to parse the message text.

data.label: Slack
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Slack user account.

children.text: Enter (map) a Channel ID of a channel whose messages you want to delete.
Enter (map) a Message ID of a message to delete.
You can watch, list, retrieve, download, upload, send and delete files using the following modules.
Triggers when a new file is added.

data.label: Slack
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Slack user account.

children.text: Select the file type for which you want to watch:
Select the channel from which you want to filter the files.
Select or map a public channel to watch the files.
Select or map a private channel to watch the files.
Select or map a user to watch the files.
Select or map a direct message to multiple people and watch the files.
Filter files to those created by the selected user.
Set the maximum number of files Make will return during one execution cycle. The default value is 2.
Returns a list of files within a team.

data.label: Slack
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Slack user account.

children.text: Select the file type you want to retrieve:
Select the channel from which to filter the files:
Select or map a public channel to list the files.
Select or map a private channel to list the files.
Select or map a user to list the files.
Select or map direct message to multiple people and list the files.
Filter files created by the selected user.
Set the start date from when you want to list the files.
Set the end date until when you want to list the files.
Set the maximum number of files Make will return during one execution cycle. The default value is 2.

data.label: Slack
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Slack user account.

children.text: Enter (map) the file ID of the file you want to retrieve details about.

data.label: Slack
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Slack user account.

children.text: Channel type - Select the channel where you want to upload the file:
Enter (map) the title of the file.
Enter (map) the Thread ID to upload the file as a reply.
Enter (map) the message text introducing the file in the specified channel.

data.label: Slack
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Slack user account.

children.text: - Select or map a public channel to create a file.
- Select or map a private channel to create a file.
- Select or map a user to create a file.
- Select or map a direct message to multiple people and create a file.
Enter (map) the name of the file. (
This is the filename when it's sent)
Enter (map) the Thread ID to create the file as a reply. (T
ext entered here will be included as a message when the file is sent)
Enter (map) the message text introducing the file in the specified channel.

data.label: Slack
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Slack user account.

children.text: Enter (map) the ID of the file you want to delete.
You can list, retrieve, list members, set the topic, set the purpose, join a channel, leave a channel, create, archive, and unarchive a channel using this module.

You can add and remove stars using the following modules.

Enter respective IDs. You can star a message by selecting a

You can pin and unpin a message using the following modules.
Pins a message to a channel.

You can watch, search, list, retrieve, invite and kick a user using the following modules.
Triggers when a new user is added or an existing user has changed. Only emit the latest change since the last scenario run.

data.label: Slack
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Slack user account.

children.text: Set the maximum number of users Make will return during one execution cycle. The default value is 2.
When setting the schedule to run your Watch Slack Users scenario, the
is restricted to Slack users with a

data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Slack user account.

You can create a reminder using the following modules.

data.label: Slack
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Slack user account.

children.text: Enter (map) the content to appear in the reminder.

Enter (map) the time when this reminder should happen. Enter the Unix timestamp (up to five years from now), the number of seconds until the reminder (if within 24 hours), or a natural language description. For example,
Select or map the user you want to create a reminder for.
You can watch new events using the following module.
Triggers when a new message or other events are created.
Enter (map) a name for the webhook.

data.label: Slack
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Slack user account.

children.text: Select or map a channel whose event you want to watch.
You can set a status in events using the following module.

data.label: Slack
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Slack user account.

children.text: Enter (map) the status text. You can enter up to 100 characters.
Enter (map) the status emojis enabled for the slack team. For example,
. The list of possible emojis can be found in the
Enter (map) the Unix Timestamp of when the status will expire.
or omitting this field results in a custom status that will not expire.
Performs an arbitrary authorized API call.

to retrieve information for an entry.
to make a partial entry update.

Enter the body content for your API call.

customCSS:
<style>
@media print {
  html, body {
    overflow-x: visible;
  }
}
#tally-widget-button {
  position: fixed !important;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  display: none;
  visibility: visible !important;
  opacity: 1 !important;
  color: #0C121D;
  border: 2px solid #0C121D;
  border-radius: 4px;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  font-size: 14px;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-family: 'Inter';
  text-align: center;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
  cursor: pointer;
  z-index: 999999 !important;
  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
  outline: none;
  touch-action: manipulation;
  pointer-events: auto;
  transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
}
.button-text {
  display: inline-block;
  margin-right: 8px;
}
.button-text::before {
  content: attr(data-text);
}
#tally-widget-popup {
  position: fixed;
  background-color: white;
  display: none;
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
  z-index: 999999;
  overflow: hidden;
  border: 0px solid #0C121D;
  padding-top: 30px;
}
#tally-widget-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 10px;
  right: 10px;
  background: none;
  border: none;
  font-size: 36px;
  font-weight: bold;
  padding: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
  color: #0C121D;
}

  .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
    font-family: 'Inter' !important;
  }

  .dark .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #F6F6F6 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column > div > div > div.flex.flex-1.w-full.justify-center.pb-0 > div > div.flex.items-center.pl-0.pr-2.mb-5.xl\:-mt-1\.5 > div > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > div.flex.pr-2.text-gray-500.items-center {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  a.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-public-space-links-wrap .ab-public-space-link:first-of-type {
    border-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-toc-item-active a{
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 {
    text-decoration-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-left:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .ab-nav-left-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-right:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .ab-nav-right-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
#tally-inline-popup {
  position: fixed;
  display: none;
  z-index: 999999;
  width: min(420px, 90vw);
  height: min(550px, 80vh);
  background: #fff;
  color: #0c121d;
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.08);
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 12px 28px rgba(0,0,0,0.22), 0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.12);
  overflow: hidden;
  padding: 5px;
}

#tally-inline-popup iframe {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  border: 0;
  display: block;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

#tally-inline-popup .tip-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 6px;
  right: 8px;
  width: 32px;
  height: 32px;
  line-height: 28px;
  font-size: 22px;
  text-align: center;
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.85);
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
  border-radius: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
}

#main-column a[data-form-url],
#main-column a[data-tally-url] {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
  text-decoration: underline;
  text-underline-offset: 2px;
  text-decoration-thickness: 1.5px;
  font-weight: 600;
}

@media (max-width: 640px) {
  #tally-inline-popup {
    width: min(360px, 94vw);
    height: min(500px, 80vh);
  }
}

#main-column .ab-cta-button a.ab-cta-button {
  background-color: #7302D5;
}

/* Titles in purple */
.ab-link-blocks-wrapper .ab-link-block-item.ab-docs-card-mode .ab-link-block-content-wrap .font-bold {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
}

.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
}

</style>

reusableContentVariables.name: string
reusableContentVariables.description: a list or sequence of characters (like letters, numbers, and symbols) used to represent text in a computer programming.

reusableContentVariables.name: Operations
reusableContentVariables.description: An operation is a single module run to process data or check for new data.

reusableContentVariables.name: Credits
reusableContentVariables.description: Credits (formerly operations) are the currency for running scenarios.

reusableContentVariables.name: Route
reusableContentVariables.description: A route is a path that data can flow through in a scenario, visualized as the dotted lines between modules.
